inputs.entrepreneur_input: AI-powered project management tool for remote software teams. Target: 10-50 person startups struggling with task coordination across time zones. Problem: Existing tools (Jira, Asana, Monday) are too complex and require dedicated project managers. Our solution uses AI to auto-assign tasks based on team member skills, availability, and workload. Revenue model: $15/user/month with 14-day free trial.

Supply side: farmers list produce with real-time inventory, set prices, and manage harvest schedules. Demand side: buyers browse by location, place orders with delivery windows, and track shipments. Revenue: 8% transaction fee from sellers plus $99/month premium tier for analytics and priority placement. Initial market: Bay Area, CA with 50 partner farms.

inputs.entrepreneur_input: Comprehensive healthcare scheduling platform for multi-location medical practices. Primary users: Practice managers at clinics with 5-20 providers across 2-5 locations. Secondary users: Patients booking appointments. The problem we solve: Current scheduling is fragmented across locations, leading to double-bookings, long wait times, and provider burnout. Existing solutions like Zocdoc are patient-facing and don't help with internal scheduling optimization. Our solution: AI-powered scheduling that considers provider preferences, travel time between locations, equipment availability, patient history, and insurance verification. Key features: 1) Smart scheduling that maximizes provider utilization while minimizing patient wait times, 2) Automated insurance verification before appointments, 3) No-show prediction with automated reminders, 4) Cross-location resource sharing, 5) Integration with major EHR systems (Epic, Cerner, Athena). Revenue model: $500/month base + $50/provider/month. Implementation: White-glove onboarding with data migration from existing systems. Target market size: 250,000 medical practices in the US with 5+ providers. Competition: Zocdoc (patient-facing), Calendly (too simple), custom EHR scheduling (poor UX). Our advantage: Purpose-built for multi-location complexity with AI optimization. Team: CEO with 10 years healthcare IT, CTO from Google Calendar team, CMO former Zocdoc. Current status: MVP built, 3 pilot customers, $50K MRR. Seeking: Validation of scalability assumptions and go-to-market strategy.

inputs.entrepreneur_input: MLOps platform providing automated feature store management with real-time feature serving, offline batch processing, and point-in-time correct training dataset generation. Built on Apache Spark for batch and Apache Flink for streaming, with Redis for low-latency serving. Supports drift detection via KL divergence monitoring and automated retraining triggers. Target: ML platform teams at Series B+ startups struggling with feature consistency between training and serving (training-serving skew). Integrates with Kubeflow, MLflow, and SageMaker. Pricing: Usage-based on feature computations.
